verses.verse: The word <S%H1697><s%> of Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> which came to Jeremiah <S%H3414><s%> the prophet <S%H5030><s%> concerning the nations. <S%H1471><s%>

Of Egypt: <S%H4714><s%> concerning the army <S%H2428><s%> of Pharaoh Necoh <S%H6549><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> which was by the river <S%H5104><s%> Euphrates <S%H6578><s%> in Carchemish, <S%H3751><s%> which Nebuchadnezzar <S%H5019><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%> struck <S%H5221><s%> in the fourth <S%H7243><s%> year <S%H8141><s%> of Jehoiakim <S%H3079><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Josiah, <S%H2977><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Judah. <S%H3063><s%>
Prepare <S%H6186><s%> the buckler <S%H4043><s%> and shield, <S%H6793><s%> and draw near <S%H5066><s%> to battle! <S%H4421><s%>

Harness <S%H631><s%> the horses, <S%H5483><s%> and get up, <S%H5927><s%> you horsemen, <S%H6571><s%> and stand forth <S%H3320><s%> with your helmets; <S%H3553><s%> furbish <S%H4838><s%> the spears, <S%H7420><s%> put on <S%H3847><s%> the coats of mail. <S%H5630><s%>

Why have I seen <S%H7200><s%> it? <S%H2844><s%> they are dismayed and are turned <S%H5472><s%> backward; <S%H268><s%> and their mighty ones <S%H1368><s%> are beaten down, <S%H3807><s%> and have fled <S%H5127><s%> apace, <S%H4498><s%> and don't <S%H6437><s%> look back: terror <S%H4032><s%> is on every side, <S%H5439><s%> says <S%H5002><s%> Yahweh. <S%H3068><s%>

Don't <S%H7031><s%> let the swift flee away, <S%H5127><s%> nor the mighty man <S%H1368><s%> escape; <S%H4422><s%> in the north <S%H6828><s%> by <S%H3027><s%> the river <S%H5104><s%> Euphrates <S%H6578><s%> have they stumbled <S%H3782><s%> and fallen. <S%H5307><s%>
Who is this who rises up <S%H5927><s%> like the Nile, <S%H2975><s%> whose waters <S%H4325><s%> toss <S%H1607><s%> themselves like the rivers? <S%H5104><s%>

Egypt <S%H4714><s%> rises up <S%H5927><s%> like the Nile, <S%H2975><s%> and his waters <S%H4325><s%> toss <S%H1607><s%> themselves like the rivers: <S%H5104><s%> and he says, <S%H559><s%> I will rise up, <S%H5927><s%> I will cover <S%H3680><s%> the earth; <S%H776><s%> I will destroy <S%H6><s%> cities <S%H5892><s%> and its inhabitants. <S%H3427><s%>

Go up, <S%H5927><s%> you horses; <S%H5483><s%> and rage, <S%H1984><s%> you chariots; <S%H7393><s%> and let the mighty men <S%H1368><s%> go forth: <S%H3318><s%> Cush <S%H3568><s%> and Put, <S%H6316><s%> who handle <S%H8610><s%> the shield; <S%H4043><s%> and the Ludim, <S%H3866><s%> who handle <S%H8610><s%> and bend <S%H1869><s%> the bow. <S%H7198><s%>

For that day <S%H3117><s%> is of the Lord, <S%H136><s%> Yahweh <S%H136><s%> of Armies, <S%H6635><s%> a day <S%H3117><s%> of vengeance, <S%H5360><s%> that he may avenge <S%H5358><s%> him of his adversaries: <S%H6862><s%> and the sword <S%H2719><s%> shall devour <S%H398><s%> and be satiate, <S%H7646><s%> and shall drink <S%H7301><s%> its fill of their blood; <S%H1818><s%> for the Lord, <S%H136><s%> Yahweh <S%H3069><s%> of Armies, <S%H6635><s%> has a sacrifice <S%H2077><s%> in the north <S%H6828><s%> country <S%H776><s%> by the river <S%H5104><s%> Euphrates. <S%H6578><s%>

Go up <S%H5927><s%> into Gilead, <S%H1568><s%> and take <S%H3947><s%> balm, <S%H6875><s%> virgin <S%H1330><s%> daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Egypt: <S%H4714><s%> in vain <S%H7723><s%> do you use many <S%H7235><s%> medicines; <S%H7499><s%> there is no healing for you. <S%H8585><s%>

The nations <S%H1471><s%> have heard <S%H8085><s%> of your shame, <S%H7036><s%> and the earth <S%H776><s%> is full of your cry; <S%H6682><s%> for the mighty <S%H1368><s%> man <S%H1368><s%> has stumbled <S%H3782><s%> against the mighty, <S%H1368><s%> they are fallen <S%H5307><s%> both <S%H8147><s%> of them together. <S%H3162><s%>

The word <S%H1697><s%> that Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> spoke <S%H1696><s%> to Jeremiah <S%H3414><s%> the prophet, <S%H5030><s%> how that Nebuchadnezzar <S%H5019><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%> should come <S%H935><s%> and strike <S%H5221><s%> the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>

Declare <S%H5046><s%> in Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> and publish <S%H8085><s%> in Migdol, <S%H4024><s%> and publish <S%H8085><s%> in Memphis <S%H5297><s%> and in Tahpanhes: <S%H8471><s%> say, <S%H559><s%> Stand forth, <S%H3320><s%> and prepare; <S%H3559><s%> for the sword <S%H2719><s%> has devoured <S%H398><s%> around you. <S%H5439><s%>
Why are your strong <S%H47><s%> ones swept away? <S%H5502><s%> they didn't <S%H5975><s%> stand, because Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> pushed them. <S%H1920><s%>

He made many <S%H7235><s%> to stumble, <S%H3782><s%> yes, <S%H5307><s%> they fell one <S%H376><s%> on another: <S%H7453><s%> and they said, <S%H559><s%> Arise, <S%H6965><s%> and let us go again <S%H7725><s%> to our own people, <S%H5971><s%> and to the land <S%H776><s%> of our birth, <S%H4138><s%> from <S%H6440><s%> the oppressing <S%H3238><s%> sword. <S%H2719><s%>
They cried <S%H7121><s%> there, <S%H6547><s%> Pharaoh king <S%H4428><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> is but a noise; <S%H7588><s%> he has let the appointed <S%H4150><s%> time pass by. <S%H5674><s%>

As I live, <S%H2416><s%> says <S%H5002><s%> the King, <S%H4428><s%> whose name <S%H8034><s%> is Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> of Armies, <S%H6635><s%> surely like Tabor <S%H8396><s%> among the mountains, <S%H2022><s%> and like Carmel <S%H3760><s%> by the sea, <S%H3220><s%> so shall he come. <S%H935><s%>

You daughter <S%H1323><s%> who dwells <S%H3427><s%> in Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> furnish <S%H6213><s%> yourself to go into captivity; <S%H3627><s%> for Memphis <S%H5297><s%> shall become a desolation, <S%H8047><s%> and shall be burnt <S%H3341><s%> up, <S%H3427><s%> without inhabitant.
Egypt <S%H4714><s%> is a very beautiful <S%H3304><s%> heifer; <S%H5697><s%> but destruction <S%H7171><s%> out <S%H935><s%> of the north <S%H6828><s%> has come, <S%H935><s%> it has come.

Also her hired men <S%H7916><s%> in the midst <S%H7130><s%> of her are like calves <S%H5695><s%> of the stall; <S%H4770><s%> for they also are turned back, <S%H6437><s%> they are fled away <S%H5127><s%> together, <S%H3162><s%> they didn't <S%H5975><s%> stand: for the day <S%H3117><s%> of their calamity <S%H343><s%> has come <S%H935><s%> on them, <S%H6256><s%> the time of their visitation. <S%H6486><s%>

The sound <S%H6963><s%> of it shall go <S%H3212><s%> like the serpent; <S%H5175><s%> for they shall march <S%H3212><s%> with an army, <S%H2428><s%> and come <S%H935><s%> against her with axes, <S%H7134><s%> as wood <S%H6086><s%> cutters. <S%H2404><s%>

They shall cut down <S%H3772><s%> her forest, <S%H3293><s%> says <S%H5002><s%> Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> though it can't <S%H2713><s%> be searched; because they are more <S%H7231><s%> than the locusts, <S%H697><s%> and are innumerable. <S%H369><s%>

The daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> shall be disappointed; <S%H3001><s%> she shall be delivered <S%H5414><s%> into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the people <S%H5971><s%> of the north. <S%H6828><s%>

Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> of Armies, <S%H6635><s%> the God <S%H430><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> says: <S%H559><s%> Behold, <S%H6485><s%> I will punish Amon <S%H527><s%> of No, <S%H4996><s%> and Pharaoh, <S%H6547><s%> and Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> with her gods, <S%H430><s%> and her kings; <S%H4428><s%> even Pharaoh, <S%H6547><s%> and those who trust in him: <S%H982><s%>

and I will deliver <S%H5414><s%> them into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of those who seek <S%H1245><s%> their lives, <S%H5315><s%> and into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of Nebuchadnezzar <S%H5019><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon, <S%H894><s%> and into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of his servants; <S%H5650><s%> and afterwards <S%H310><s%> it shall be inhabited, <S%H7931><s%> as in the days <S%H3117><s%> of old, <S%H6924><s%> says <S%H5002><s%> Yahweh. <S%H3068><s%>

But don't <S%H3372><s%> you be afraid, Jacob <S%H3290><s%> my servant, <S%H5650><s%> neither be dismayed, <S%H2865><s%> Israel: <S%H3478><s%> for, <S%H3467><s%> behold, I will save you from afar, <S%H7350><s%> and your seed <S%H2233><s%> from the land <S%H776><s%> of their captivity; <S%H7628><s%> and Jacob <S%H3290><s%> shall return, <S%H7725><s%> and shall be quiet <S%H8252><s%> and at ease, <S%H7599><s%> and none shall make him afraid. <S%H2729><s%>

Don't <S%H3372><s%> you be afraid, O Jacob <S%H3290><s%> my servant, <S%H5650><s%> says <S%H5002><s%> Yahweh; <S%H3068><s%> for I am with you: <S%H6213><s%> for I will make a full end <S%H3617><s%> of all the nations <S%H1471><s%> where I have driven <S%H5080><s%> you; <S%H6213><s%> but I will not make a full end <S%H3617><s%> of you, <S%H3256><s%> but I will correct you in measure, <S%H4941><s%> and will in no way <S%H5352><s%> leave you unpunished. <S%H5352><s%>
